Gujarat Vidyapith is a deemed university founded by Mahatma Gandhi on 18 October 1920. It follows Gandhian values and offers programs from UG to PhD in humanities, social sciences, education, science and rural management. For official details, visit the university website: https://gujaratvidyapith.org
Gujarat Vidyapith, started by Mahatma Gandhi in 1920, is a Gandhian university with many UG, PG and PhD programs. You can see the full profile on the official site.

patterns: how can i apply for admission
responses: Admissions are done through the official admission portal and prospectus. Common steps: check eligibility in the prospectus, fill the online form, appear for entrance/merit process if required, then complete document verification and fee payment. To get admission, first check the latest admission brochure, then apply online as per the schedule, and follow the entrance/merit and document verification process mentioned there.

patterns: which documents are required for admission
what documents do i need for gujarat vidyapith admission
responses: Common documents include: 10th and 12th mark sheets, graduation mark sheets (for PG), transfer/college leaving certificate, ID proof, passport-size photos, caste/ reservation certificate if applicable, and entrance score card if required. You will normally need your previous exam mark sheets, ID proof, photos, transfer certificate and category certificates (if applicable). Confirm the exact list in the official admission brochure.
